messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] 3 boy families
messages.msgSnippet: hey Georganne, How are you?  We will probably be at the same group.  I too am in Central NJ, near Trenton.  Welcome to the list. Bonnie ...
messages.messageBody:
hey Georganne,

How are you? We will probably be at the same group. I too am in Central
NJ, near Trenton. Welcome to the list.

Bonnie


>From: GeorganneD@...
>Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] 3 boy families
>Date: Wed, 14 Mar 2001 17:31:48 EST
>
>Count me almost in on the 3 boy list. My triplets are almost three and
>I've
>subscribed to the list so that I can benefit from thinking about what you
>all
>have to say as they grow. Just finished Learning All the Time by John Holt
>and am only sorry I didn't read it sooner. Very exciting book. Nicki just
>introduced herself as having a 5 yr old and I'll be watching how it goes
>with
>her. Having three the same age is a slightly different kettle of fish in
>all
>areas, but kids are kids everywhere. I live in central NJ and haven't
>hooked
>up with our local support group yet because the boys still nap in the
>afternoon and the group meets once a week at a park/skating rink during
>naptime.

_________________________________________________________________

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] 3 boy families
messages.msgSnippet: Count me in on the three boy club.  My three are 1, 5, and 8.  Anybody have three girls?  I have three girls too. Kimme
messages.messageBody:
Count me in on the three boy "club." My three are 1, 5, and 8. Anybody have
three girls? I have three girls too. Kimme
